climate: Hardy crop, grows well in rainfed hills upto 2000m altitude.
soil: Average fertility, well-drained sandy loam to clay loam.
sowing_method: Direct sowing or Transplanting (3-4 week old seedlings).
harvesting: September-October when cooling starts. Duration 105-120 days.
content: Mandua is the main staple food crop of Uttarakhand hills. It is rich in Calcium and Iron. It is highly drought tolerant. For organic farming, use vermicompost. Rotate with Soya or Urd.

sowing_method: Broadcasting or Line Sowing (25 cm apart).
content: Jhangora is the fastest growing millet, suitable for fragile ecosystems. It has low glycemic index, good for diabetics. Often intercropped with Mandua or Pulses.

soil: Sandy loam with good drainage and high organic matter. pH 6.0-7.0.
content: Tomato is widely grown in Uttarakhand polyhouses. Staking is required for indeterminate varieties. Major pest is Fruit Borer. Use pheromone traps.

climate: Temperate, requires chilling hours (1000-1500 hrs). Zones 1500-2500m.
soil: Deep loamy soil rich in organic matter.
fertilizer: Age based. Adult tree: 700g N, 350g P, 700g K per year.
harvesting: July to October depending on altitude.
content: Uttarakhand 'Seb Production' is centered in Harsil, Mukteshwar. Pruning is done in Dec-Jan. Pollinizer varieties (Goldens) are essential (20-30%) for fruit set.
Gahat is famous in Uttarakhand for treating kidney stones (pathri). It improves soil nitrogen. Grown on residual moisture.
